reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the hotel based on the on-line photos. Unfortunately, the room was not as nice as those depicted in the photos. Our room was smallish but probably normal for Paris, the bathroom was nice and modern. The walls were thin and I could hear people talking at normal voice level. I will say, I liked the decor of the hotel lobby which incorporates French style with modern charms. I do think now that the hotel is a bit pricey for the room. I might have enjoyed our stay more if I had a better idea of what the room would be like. I think hotels, in general, should include a range of room photos and not just the higher priced suites. It's misleading and can lead to disappointment.
reviews.title: okay but the photos are a bit misleading

reviews.text: Nice hotel, completely redone when I stayed there. Nice hotels in Paris are difficult to find or they are expensive, this one is a good one. I managed to get a much MUCH cheaper rate so please check carefully on the web.
reviews.title: Pricey but nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Vernet for our 25th anniversary and had a wonderful stay. From the fruit and champange in the room awaiting us to the wonderful breakfast, especially nice because it can be brought to your room for the ultimate breakfast in bed. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The bar was comfortable and stylish and offered a great selection of wine, always accompanied by some goodies. The bartender friendly and attentive. The location was excellent, being a couple of blocks from the Arc de Triumph and the Champs Elysee. There is a Drugstore located a block away with wonderful brasserie and fabulous take it with you foods,drinks, pharmacy, cosmetics counter, and newstand.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel with Great Staff

reviews.text: We will definately stay at the Hotel Vernet our next trip to France.
reviews.title: ditto on dissappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel lobby, bar and restaurant is beautifully decorated and concierge was quite helpful with making reservations and collecting concert tickets in advance of my visit. I had sprung for a delux room on the 5th floor and the room was classic french with beautiful heavy draperies and lovely chandelier over the bed. The room had a walk in closet with plenty of hangers. Excellent water pressure on the shower. However...... the room carpet had several stains and probably needs to be replaced. I put my only pair of shoes out for polishing the night before and had to make 3 calls the next day before they were returned at 11:00 a.m. During the 6 days I was there, the fire alarm went off on four separate days. During these alarms, the staff stayed at their stations and did not provide any assistance or explanation unless asked. On alarm #1, the guest across from me called the front desk and was told to ignore it. On #2 and #3, I called down and heard it was false. I finally asked the concierge what was the problem. He said they had installed a new alarm system and the installer was required to come whenever they pleased and pull the alarm to ensure it was working. So the staff knew there was no fire and the concierge acted a little surprised that I was complaining. The hotel had not informed the guests this would occur and did not take into account that the guests would react when they heard the alarm. Because the hotel did a poor job of managing guest relations they get a poor review from me. Will they be as laissez faire during a real fire?
reviews.title: Disappointing

likes.disliked: — Disappointed there was no jacuzzi and wi-fi access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 days at the end of May 2010. You almost feel as if you are staying in an apartment because the hotel is in a small building on a quiet side street & we rarely saw another guest in the hotel. The best part of the hotel to us - was the convenient central location for sight seeing and the extremely spacious room (especially for Paris or any other big city at this price). There was a long entrance hallways, walk-in closet, spacious bathroom and bedroom.
reviews.title: Convenient Location just off Champs Elysees, Quiet & Clean Escape, Large Rooms!

reviews.text: We were on the 2nd floor facing the street, but never had any trouble sleeping due to the heavy curtains & very comfortable bed, sheets, pillow. There was construction going on out front & we were never bothered by it. The downside is that there wasn't any view or light, but since we were out all day & just came home to relax & sleep it wasn't an issue for us.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.text: We would have liked to check out the beautiful restaurant or bar area on the first floor, but we never saw either open during the entire length of our stay including on a Saturday night? Perhaps it was open at some point during our stay, but never when we looked into it. We did have room service for breakfast a few times & it was nice.
reviews.title: Lost the plot

reviews.text: They should not advertise that they have free wifi as the service rarely ever works & when it did it was extremely slow. This was extremely frustrating as we took internet access into consideration when choosing a hotel. The front desk didn't seem to know how to handle the situation.
reviews.title: Nice comeback
Wonderful memories and very comfortable
reviews.text: There weren't any outlets in the bathroom for hair appliances (curling iron, straightener, hairdryer, etc) There was one in the hallways outside of the bathroom which wasn't very convenient at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a good hotel in a great location. Quiet but central. Of course, it all depends on the rate you pay. For a small room, we paid just over 300 euros. Doesn't get you much in this part of town and this was a good option for that price. If you can pay less (which it seems some contributors could at times) it would be great. It's not worth a lot more at least for a basic room.
reviews.title: Can't complain
:"good bones", but the bloom seems to be a bit off the rose.
reviews.text: Facilities are limited. Wifi was not even working. But staff are charming and keen to please. Not always a given in Paris.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Immediate impression was that of a somewhat starkly elegant boutique hotel in a good location. Our first night was a bit of a disaster as despite our room on the 5th floor and assurances that NO guests had ever complained about street noise on this street side room, we were awakened at 4am with loud noises of garbage pick-up , bottles being tossed en mass, motorcycles/scooters, barely warm water from the bath. Then we find out that the beautiful dining room is only open for bkfst,/ lunch as their Michelin rating is gone. Dinner can be served to guests in the salons outside the restaurant only. No lower level bar as was advertised on other sites...they lost that along with the chef. We kindly voiced our complaints and were then put in a spacious, coldly modern jr suite...but it was very welcome indeed and we appreciated their response. All in all, the staff were kind and helpful, the bkfst was very good, the light dinner we had in a salon one night when we were too tired to go out was actually very good, and the whole place rather grew on us and became a tranquil and pretty elegant oasis as the end of the day. My sense is that it is a hotel in transition from what it was to where it may be going. The place needs a bit warmer palette and more of what is going on in the salons , a little richer overall feel. Let it be what it wants to be. The designer fell into the "taupe trap" and the mauve really does not work, esp in the dining room! It needs more richness, more warmth. Maria at the front desk the woman in the dining room at bkfst could be less officious ...the rest of the staff were simply terrific. It is a place that feels like it's riding the line and itt wants to be great!
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Vernet hotel over labor day weekend and had a fantastic time. The hotel is located just couple blocks away from the Arc and the Louis Vuitton flagship store. The location is perfect for shopping b/c the Montage Ave is just around the corner. It's walking distance to most tourist places (Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Notre Damm , or even Latin Quarter, etc... )
reviews.title: awful and dissapointing hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is big for European standard. Bathroom is clean. Bed is comfortable. They clean the room well. The best thing is they have Wifi in the room, which i find uncommon in most hotels.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our travel agent booked this hotel for our Paris portion of our honeymoon assuring us we would be very happy. We absolutely were.
reviews.title: This place is amazing.

reviews.text: The location was phenomenal. Being steps away from the Arc de Triomphe and almost directly on the Champs-Elysées made walking to everywhere we wanted to go pretty easy. We were surrounded by restaurants and shops and walked across the street when we ran out of wine.
reviews.title: Very nice and quiet place, close to Champs Elysées, excellent staff

reviews.text: The front desk let us check in to our room at 10:00am instead of 3:00pm after our overnight flight from Boston and they made us feel extremely welcome throughout our stay helping us out with recommendations, reservations, and just whatever we needed.
reviews.title: Really pleasant surprise in the very center of Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was gorgeous but we only ate breakfast there. The food was very French and fantastic and if we didn't make it downstairs in time, we just called and they sent up a grand assortment of breakfast to our room.
reviews.title: Perfectly19th century

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very highly recommended and when we go back to Paris, we know exactly where we're staying.
reviews.title: Great location, hotel lacks atmoshere and speed.
